Job Title: Unreal Engine Software Engineer

Location: Lutz, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

Job details

Extremely Well-Known Aviation Company - Amazing Benefits + Work Culture + More!

This Jobot Job is hosted by Caitlyn Hardy

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume.

Salary $90,000 - $170,000 per year

A Bit About Us

Well-known, established, and stable aviation company, located in Lutz, Florida, in search of an experienced Software Engineer who is well-versed with the Unreal Engine to join our growing team. This is a direct-hire opportunity and you will work on cutting-edge prototypes for a brand new flight simulator project we are implementing. The preferred candidate must have strong programming skills, be able to work independently and as part of a team, and have a passion for working on and creating high quality immersive virtual reality experiences.



Why join us?


Competitive starting salaries with growth potentialHealth benefits beginning day oneTuition assistance and continuing education programsPaid holidaysRelocation assistance (terms and conditions apply)Flight training courses and bonuses (terms and conditions apply)Sign-on Bonus

Job Details

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES (including But Not Limited To)

Design, develop, integrate, test, and document virtual reality software for use in flight simulation training device

Design and implement procedural asset creation techniques to efficiently generate and modify 3D models, textures, and environments for immersive virtual reality experiences

Design and implement innovative solutions for optimizing performance and reducing latency of virtual reality software and hardware

Participate in engineering design reviews, hardware/software integration, stakeholder demonstrations, and acceptance testing events

Create and maintain documentation for virtual reality software and hardware solutions (e.g. Acceptance Test Procedures, Interface Control Documents, Technical Specifications, Work Flows)

Qualifications

Minimum of 5 years of relative computer science/software engineering, or technical experience. Proficiency in C++, Linux OS, Git version controlStrong working knowledge of Unreal Engine 5 (UE)Experience with Virtual Reality (VR) / Augmented Reality (AR) hardware devices such as headsets, controllers, tracking systems (e.g. Varjo, HoloLens, HTC Vive, Oculus)Proficiency in debugging, optimization, and performance tuning for VR experiencesDeep understanding of 3D graphics & rendering pipelines, visual effects, modeling, shaders (HLSL/GLSL), texturing, and lighting for simulation environments3D modeling using BlenderVersion control of large file sets for 3D models, textures, environmentsIntegrating & testing Unreal Engine Geospatial Plug-ins (e.g. Cesium, ArcGis, Blackshark)
